codeandchords

Class ModuleMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • codeandchords.MenuTemplate
      • codeandchords.ModuleMenu

  • public class ModuleMenu
extends MenuTemplate
    July 2017 Class for creating a sidebar Menu for a Module; previously was ModuleTemplate.
    Author:
    Emily Meuer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CS_CUSTOM 
      static int CS_DICHROM 
      static int CS_RAINBOW
      Color Styles: Rainbow, Dichromatic (fade from one color to another throughout the legend), Trichromatic (fade from color1 to color2 and then from color2 to color3 throughout the legend), or Custom, which may be discontinued.
      static int CS_TRICHROM 
      java.lang.String[] noteNames
      This list of notes is to be used for custom color select Button labels

      Called from MenuTemplate for Buttons that were added by the addColorWheelGroup() method and are connected to a CW and CWTextfield (MenuTemplate has already updated the CW and Textfield values).

      Called from MenuTemplate for ColorWheels that were added by the addColorWheelGroup() method and are connected to a Button and CWTextfield (MenuTemplate has already updated the Textfield value).
      void controlEvent(ControlEvent controlEvent)
      Since ModuleTemplate implements ControlListener, it needs to have this method to "catch" the controlEvents from the ControlP5 (controlP5).
      void cycleLyrics(int keyCode)

      Converts the given color to HSB and sends it to dichromatic_OneHSB.
      void dichromatic_TwoRGB(int[] rgbVals1, int[] rgbVals2, int inputNum)
      This method fills colors with the spectrum of colors between the given rgb colors.

      void setColorStyle(int newColorStyle, int inputNum)
      Sets the ColorStyle to the given ColorStyle and locks or unlocks the appropriate Buttons (e.g., in Rainbow, Tonic, 2ndColor and 3rdColor Buttons should all be unlocked, but for Dichromatic, only 3rdColor should be locked).
      void setCurKey(java.lang.String key, int majMinChrom)
      Updates the keyDropdown ScrollableList and sets the current key and all connected variables: this.majMinChrom, this.scaleLength, this.curKey, this.keyAddVal.
      void setCurrentInput(int newCurrentInput) 
      void setDichromFlag(boolean newVal)
      Use when you don't want the first call to dichrom to trigger auto-generated colors (Red-Pink).
      void setDynamicBars(boolean newVal) 
      void setGlobal(boolean newGlobal) 
      void setGoalHue(int position)
      Sets this.goalHue to the value of the given position in this.colors (important that it sets this in colors and not legendColors, since colors has the correct saturation and brightness for this particular volume)
      void setHueSatBrightnessMod(int position, float val)
      Sets either global hue, saturation, or brightness modulate to the given value
      void setMenuVal()
      communicates with keyPressed event in draw() of driver shows menu button on key press added 1/26/17 Elena Ryan
      void setShowPlayStop(boolean showPlayStop) 
      void setShowScale(boolean showScale)

      Method to set a specialColors ColorWheel; used when switching to a new curInputNum, because it updates the ColorWheel without affecting this.colors.

      Use when you don't want the first call to trichrom to trigger auto-generated colors (Red-Green-Blue).
      void setUseRecInput(boolean newVal) 
      void showColorMenu() 
      void showColorMenu(java.lang.String tabName) 
      void showOutsideButtons()
      Uses this.showPlayStop, this.showPause, and this.showHamburger to determine which of the outside Buttons should be set to visible.
      void showShapeMenu()

      Called from MenuTemplate for Sliders that were added by the addSliderGroup() method and are connected to a Textfield (MenuTemplate has already updated the Textfield value).
      void smoothAmpScale(int inputNum)
      In progress; will eventually allow shape size to change smoothly over time, like fade() does to color, rather than jumping as it currently does.
      void trichromatic_OneRGB(int[] rgbVals, int inputNum)
      Converts the given color to HSB and sends it to dichromatic_OneHSB.
      void trichromatic_ThreeRGB(int[] rgbVals1, int[] rgbVals2, int[] rgbVals3, int inputNum)
      Calculates the colors between the 3 sets of given vals and fills colors with a spectrum fading between them.
      void universalFade(int fadeThis)

      this method updates the amplitude follower and needs to be called every time in the draw loop for each input that is using it.

    • Field Detail

      • noteNames

        public final java.lang.String[] noteNames
        This list of notes is to be used for custom color select Button labels

      • CS_RAINBOW

        public static int CS_RAINBOW
        Color Styles: Rainbow, Dichromatic (fade from one color to another throughout the legend), Trichromatic (fade from color1 to color2 and then from color2 to color3 throughout the legend), or Custom, which may be discontinued.

      • ModuleMenu

                  Module module,
                  Input input,
                  int totalNumColorItems)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet used to draw, etc.; will instantiate this.parent instance var
        input - Input for all audio input; will instantiate this.input
        sidebarTitle - String designating the title of the module to which this template corresponds

    • Method Detail

      • addLandingMenu

        public void addLandingMenu()
        Adds the Landing Menu by setting the label of the default tab.

      • addSensitivityMenu

        public void addSensitivityMenu(boolean pitch)
        Adds the Attack/Release/Transition Sliders, Piano and Forte Threshold Sliders, Saturation/Brightness Percent Sliders, and - optionally - the Key Select and Guide Tone Popout.
        Parameters:
        pitch - if true, includes the Key Select and Guide Tone Popout

      • addColorMenu

        public void addColorMenu()
        Adds the normal, 12-note Color Menu, with "Canvas"/"Tonic"/etc. special colors and no range segments.

      • addColorMenu

        public void addColorMenu(java.lang.String[] colorSelectLabels,
                         int numColorSelectRows,
                         boolean colorSelectCanvas,
                         java.lang.String[] specialColorLabels,
                         boolean specialColorCanvas,
                         boolean colorStyles,
                         java.lang.String rangeSegmentsLabel,
                         int maxRangeSegments,
                         int defaultRangeSegments,
                         java.lang.String tabName)
        Adds the Color Select CWs, Special Colors CWs (optional), Color Style Buttons (optional), and Hue/Saturation/Brightness and Red/Green/Blue modulate Sliders
        Parameters:
        colorSelectLabels - String[] with text for each of the color select Buttons' labels
        numColorSelectRows - int indicating the number of rows of ColorSelect Buttons
        colorSelectCanvas - boolean indicating whether the Button for canvas is included with colorSelect
        specialColorLabels - String[] with text for each of the special colors Buttons' labels; if null, special colors Buttons will not be added
        specialColorCanvas - boolean indicating whether the Button for canvas is included with specialColors
        colorStyles - boolean indicating whether or not to include the color style Buttons
        rangeSegmentsLabel - label text for range segments group; if null, range segments will not be added
        maxRangeSegments - the maximum number of range segments (will be ignored if previous String param is null)
        defaultRangeSegments - the default number of range segments (will be ignored if previous String param is null)
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addShapeMenu

      • addColorSelect

        public void addColorSelect(int xVal,
                           int[] yVals,
                           java.lang.String[] buttonLabels,
                           java.lang.String labelText,
                           boolean canvas,
                           java.lang.String tabName)
        Adds the Buttons, ColorWheels and Textfields for selecting custom colors.
        Parameters:
        yVals - yValue(s) for the row or rows of Buttons
        buttonLabels - String[] of labels for the color select Buttons; length of this array determines the number of colorSelect Buttons; if including canvas in this row, the first element of this array must be "Canvas"
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addOutsideButtons

        public void addOutsideButtons()
        Adds "outside buttons": hamburger and play/pause/stop Buttons

      • addHideButtons

        public void addHideButtons(int xVal,
                           int hideY)
        Adds "hide buttons" - hide Menu, hide Play Button, and hide Legend TODO: maybe shouldn't add them to the LandingMenu Tab every time?
        Parameters:
        hideY - y value at which the row will be displayed

      • addARTSliders

        public void addARTSliders(int xVal,
                          int attackY,
                          int releaseY,
                          int transitionY)
        Adds the attack, release, and transition Sliders.
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of the whole group
        attackY - y value for attack Slider
        releaseY - y value for release Slider
        transitionY - y value for transition Slider

        yVal - y value of Slider

      • addKeySelector

        public void addKeySelector(int xVal,
                           int keyY)
        Method called during instantiation to initialize the key selector drop-down menu (ScrollableList) and major/minor/chromatic selection buttons.
        Parameters:
        keyY - y value of the menu and buttons.

      • addGuideTonePopout

        public void addGuideTonePopout(int xVal,
                               int guideToneY)
        Adds the guide tone pop-out with range and envelope preset select dropdowns, bpm and volume sliders.
        Parameters:
        guideToneY - y value for the top of the pop-out; for ModuleTemplate_01, this is same as the value for addKeySelector

        public void addHSBSliders(int xVal,
                          int[] hsb)
        Adds the hue, saturation, and brightness modulate sliders
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        hsb - array of y values for each slider

        hsb - array of y values for each slider
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addModulateSliders

        public void addModulateSliders(int xVal,
                               int[] modulateYVals)
        Method called during instantiation, to initialize the RGB color modulate sliders.
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        modulateYVals - int[] of the y values of the red, green, and blue sliders, respectively.

      • addModulateSliders

        public void addModulateSliders(int xVal,
                               int[] modulateYVals,
                               java.lang.String tabName)
        Method called during instantiation, to initialize the RGB color modulate sliders.
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        modulateYVals - int[] of the y values of the red, green, and blue sliders, respectively.
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

                               int yVal)

      • addRangeSegments

        public void addRangeSegments(int xVal,
                             int yVal,
                             int numSegments,
                             java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.String tabName)
        Adds the Buttons for selecting the number of range segments.
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        yVal - y value for the row of Buttons
        numSegments - total number of segments (current number of segments will be set to this total)
        label - text to display on the label at the beginning of the row
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addRangeSegments

        public void addRangeSegments(int xVal,
                             int yVal,
                             int numSegments,
                             int defaultNumSegments,
                             java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.String tabName)
        Adds the Buttons for selecting the number of range segments.
        Parameters:
        yVal - y value for the row of Buttons
        numSegments - total number of range segments
        defaultNumSegments - number of segments that are set as current at the beginning
        label - text to display on the label at the beginning of the row
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addThresholdSliders

        public void addThresholdSliders(int xVal,
                                int yVal,
                                int verticalSpacer)
        Adds the "Color: Forte Threshold", "Saturation", "Saturation: Forte Threshold", "Brightness", and "Brightness: Forte Threshold" group of Sliders/Textfields
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        yVal - y value of forte threshold
        verticalSpacer - vertical space between sliders

      • addSpecialColors

        public void addSpecialColors(int xVal,
                             int yVal,
                             java.lang.String[] buttonLabels,
                             java.lang.String labelText,
                             boolean canvas,
                             java.lang.String tabName)
        Adds the Button/ColorWheel/Textfield groups for colors that will have a special function, e.g., "Tonic", "2nd Color", and "3rd Color" in Module_01.
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        yVal - the y value for the row
        buttonLabels - String[] of text for the buttons; if canvas color in this row of Buttons, first item should be "Canvas"
        labelText - text of the Label on the far left of the row
        canvas - boolean indicating whether or not the Canvas color Button is included in this row
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • addColorStyleButtons

        public void addColorStyleButtons(int xVal,
                                 int colorStyleY,
                                 java.lang.String tabName)
        Method called during instantiation to initialize the color style Toggles (Rainbow, Dichromatic, Trichromatic, and Custom).
        Parameters:
        xVal - x value for the leftmost edge of this group
        colorStyleY - y value of the colorStyle Toggles
        tabName - String indicating to which Tab this group of Controllers should be added (for no Tab, use "default")

      • setGoalHue

        public void setGoalHue(int position)
        Sets this.goalHue to the value of the given position in this.colors (important that it sets this in colors and not legendColors, since colors has the correct saturation and brightness for this particular volume)
        Parameters:
        position - either a position in colors or -1 for canvas color

      • universalFade

        public void universalFade(int fadeThis)

      • fadeColor

        public void fadeColor(int position,
                      int inputNum)
        Takes the values of curHue from its current values to the values in goalHue over the time that is designated by the attack, release, and transition sliders
        Parameters:
        position - position in colors to which curHue should fade

      • updateAmplitudeFollower

        public void updateAmplitudeFollower(int numInput,
                                    int followerType)
        this method updates the amplitude follower and needs to be called every time in the draw loop for each input that is using it.
        Parameters:
        numInput: - Controls the input that is updated
        followerType: - Controls the style of amplitude follower that is implemented

      • getAmplitudeFollower

        public float getAmplitudeFollower(int numInput)

                          int inputNum)
        Takes the values of curHue from its current values to the values in goalHue over the time that is designated by the attack, release, and transition sliders
        Parameters:
        position - position in colors to which curHue should fade

      • smoothAmpScale

        public void smoothAmpScale(int inputNum)
        In progress; will eventually allow shape size to change smoothly over time, like fade() does to color, rather than jumping as it currently does. (Mar. 2018)
        Parameters:
        inputNum -

      • dichromatic_OneRGB

        public void dichromatic_OneRGB(int[] rgbVals,
                               int inputNum)
        Converts the given color to HSB and sends it to dichromatic_OneHSB. (dichromatic_OneHSB will send it to _TwoHSB, which will set this.colors, changing the scale.)
        Parameters:
        rgbVals - float[] of RGB values defining the color for the tonic of the scale.

      • dichromatic_TwoRGB

        public void dichromatic_TwoRGB(int[] rgbVals1,
                               int[] rgbVals2,
                               int inputNum)
        This method fills colors with the spectrum of colors between the given rgb colors.
        Parameters:
        rgbVals1 - float[] of rgb values defining tonicColor.
        rgbVals2 - float[] of rgb values defining the color of the last note of the scale.

      • trichromatic_OneRGB

        public void trichromatic_OneRGB(int[] rgbVals,
                                int inputNum)
        Converts the given color to HSB and sends it to dichromatic_OneHSB. (dichromatic_OneHSB will send it to _TwoHSB, which will set this.colors, changing the scale.)
        Parameters:
        rgbVals - float[] of RGB values defining the color for the tonic of the scale.

      • trichromatic_ThreeRGB

        public void trichromatic_ThreeRGB(int[] rgbVals1,
                                  int[] rgbVals2,
                                  int[] rgbVals3,
                                  int inputNum)
        Calculates the colors between the 3 sets of given vals and fills colors with a spectrum fading between them.
        Parameters:
        rgbVals1 - rgb vals for the tonic color
        rgbVals2 - rgb vals for the sub-dominant for major/minor scales or "5th scale degree" (counting by half steps) for chromatic scales
        rgbVals3 - rgb vals for the dominant for major/minor scales or the "9th scale degree" (counting by half steps) for chromatic scales

      • setColorStyle

        public void setColorStyle(int newColorStyle,
                          int inputNum)
        Sets the ColorStyle to the given ColorStyle and locks or unlocks the appropriate Buttons (e.g., in Rainbow, Tonic, 2ndColor and 3rdColor Buttons should all be unlocked, but for Dichromatic, only 3rdColor should be locked).
        Parameters:
        newColorStyle - int between 1 and 4 indicating the new ColorStyle
        inputNum - the input for which to change the colorStyle

      • showOutsideButtons

        public void showOutsideButtons()
        Uses this.showPlayStop, this.showPause, and this.showHamburger to determine which of the outside Buttons should be set to visible.

      • controlEvent

        public void controlEvent(ControlEvent controlEvent)
        Since ModuleTemplate implements ControlListener, it needs to have this method to "catch" the controlEvents from the ControlP5 (controlP5). Any child classes that want to also use controlEvents can have their own controlEvent as long as they call super.controlEvent first.
        Overrides:
        controlEvent in class MenuTemplate
        Parameters:
        controlEvent - event from the current Controller

      • sliderEvent

                        float val)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • cycleLyrics

        public void cycleLyrics(int keyCode)

      • getScale

        public java.lang.String[] getScale(java.lang.String key,
                                   int majMinChrom)
        Given the name of a key (e.g., "A#", "Bb") and the quality (0 for major, 1 for minor, 2 for chromatic), returns the appropriate scale (minor = natural minor).
        Parameters:
        key - String indicating the key of the scale
        majMinChrom - int indicating quality of the scale: 0 = major, 1 = minor, 2 = chromatic
        Returns:
        String[] with the notes of this particular scale

      • setCurKey

        public void setCurKey(java.lang.String key,
                      int majMinChrom)
        Updates the keyDropdown ScrollableList and sets the current key and all connected variables: this.majMinChrom, this.scaleLength, this.curKey, this.keyAddVal.
        Parameters:
        key - String indicating the key (e.g., "D", "Eb")
        majMinChrom - int indicating quality of the scale: 0 = major, 1 = minor, 2 = chromatic
